name: keywords
description: Explanation of LSL keyword categories (State, Events, Types, Constants, Flow Control, Functions), which are reserved and cannot be used as identifiers

details.purpose: To guide AI in understanding and correctly using LSL keywords, ensuring they are never used as variable, function, or state names

keyword_categories.name: state
keyword_categories.description: Keywords for defining and transitioning between states, such as 'default' and 'state'
keyword_categories.context: Used to structure script behavior with state declarations and transitions

keyword_categories.name: events
keyword_categories.description: Keywords for event handlers (e.g., 'state_entry', 'touch_start'), defined only within states to handle triggers
keyword_categories.context: Drives interactivity by responding to actions or conditions

keyword_categories.name: types
keyword_categories.description: Keywords for data types, such as 'integer', 'string', and 'vector', used in variable and parameter declarations
keyword_categories.context: Defines the structure of data in scripts

keyword_categories.name: constants
keyword_categories.description: Predefined constant keywords (e.g., 'TRUE', 'FALSE', 'PI') used in calculations and logic
keyword_categories.context: Provides fixed values for consistent behavior

keyword_categories.name: flow_control
keyword_categories.description: Keywords for control structures, such as 'if', 'while', and 'return', to manage script execution flow
keyword_categories.context: Controls logic and decision-making in scripts

keyword_categories.name: functions
keyword_categories.description: Keywords for built-in LSL function names (e.g., 'llSay', 'llSetTimer'), excluding parameter names
keyword_categories.context: Invokes built-in functionality for script operations

rules.description: Keywords are case-sensitive reserved words that cannot be used as variable names, function names, or state names under any circumstances
rules.recommendation: Check keyword lists in referenced files before naming identifiers

best_practices: Use exact keyword spelling due to case sensitivity
Never use keywords as variable, function, or state names to avoid compilation errors
Refer to category-specific keyword files for complete lists
Consult the LSL Portal for updates on new keywords

references.title: LSL Wiki: Getting Started with LSL
LSL Wiki: A Basic LSL Tutorial
